SSL_GENERIC_READ_ERROR: An SSL error occurred while trying to read data from the server “%@”. Verify that this server supports SSL and that your account settings are correct.
SMIME_OTHER_ENCRYPTION_CERT_ERROR_MESSAG: An error occurred while searching for an encryption certificate for “%@” in your keychain.
IMAP_SERVER_ALERT_FORMAT:
The IMAP server for “%1$@” wishes to alert you to the following:

%2$@
SMTP_1_BAD_RECIPIENT: The recipient “%@” was rejected by the server.
TLS_NOT_SUPPORTED_FORMAT: The %1$@ server “%2$@” doesn’t support TLS (SSL) on port %3$u. Please check your account settings and try again.
SSL_GENERIC_WRITE_ERROR: An SSL error occurred while trying to provide data to the server “%@”. Verify that this server supports SSL and that your account settings are correct.
SMIME_MISSING_REMOTE_ENCRYPTION_CERT_MES: An encryption certificate for “%@” could not be found on the server. Without a certificate, you can’t encrypt messages sent to this address.
SMTP_NO_CONNECTION: The connection to the outgoing server “%@” failed. Additional Outgoing Mail Servers can be configured in Settings > Mail, Contacts, Calendars.
AUTH_NOT_SUPPORTED_FORMAT: The %1$@ server “%2$@” doesn’t support %3$@ authentication. Please check your account settings and try again.
CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT: The connection to the server “%1$@” on port %2$d timed out.
SMIME_UNREADABLE_SIG: There was a problem reading the digital signature for this message.
FAILED_SEND: Check the account settings for the outgoing server “%@”.
FAILED_SEND_SSL_NEEDED: Check the SSL setting for the outgoing server “%@”.
YAHOO_ACCOUNT_LOCKED_ERROR: This account will unlock in 48 hours.
MF_FAILED_SEND_MESSAGE_TOO_LARGE: The message was rejected by the server because it is too large.
SMTP_GENERIC_ERROR_FORMAT: An error occurred while delivering this message via the SMTP server “%@”
SMIME_MISSING_SIGNING_IDENTITY_FORMAT: You can’t send signed messages because a signing identity for the address “%@” could not be found.  Go to the Advanced settings for this account to choose a signing identity.
SSL_HOST_MISMATCH_MESSAGE: The certificate hostname does not match “%@”.
TLS_FAILED_FORMAT: Starting TLS failed on %1$@ server “%2$@”. Please check your account settings and try again.
SMTP_BAD_RECIPIENTS: The recipients were rejected by the server.
MAILBOX_NAME_INCLUDES_SPECIAL_CHARACTERS: This account does not allow mailbox names containing “%@”.
MF_FAILED_SEND_INACTIVE_ACCOUNT: This account is inactive. Check the settings in Settings > Mail, Contacts, Calendars.
SSL_CERT_EXPIRED_FORMAT: The certificate for this server has expired.
CANNOT_DECODE_MULTIPART_MESSAGE:
This message cannot be displayed because of the way it is formatted. Ask the sender to send it again using a different format or email program.

%1$@/%2$@
SSL_BAD_CERT_FORMAT: The format of the certificate for the server is bad.
MIME_GENERIC_REMOTE_ENCRYPTION_CERT_MESS: An error occurred while retrieving the encryption certificate.
SMTP_RECIPIENTS_UNRECOGNIZED: Verify that you have addressed this message correctly. Check your SMTP server settings in Mail Preferences and verify any advanced settings with your system administrator.
SMIME_CANT_ENCRYPT_FOR_USER_MESSAGE: An error occurred while trying to encrypt your message for “%@”. Verify that you have a valid certificate in your keychain for this address.
SMIME_MISSING_SIGNING_AND_ENCRYPTION_IDE: You can’t send signed or encrypted messages because identities for the address “%@” could not be found.  Go to the Advanced settings for this account to choose signing and encryption identities.
YAHOO_ANTIBOT_ERROR: Log into your Yahoo! Account at www.yahoo.com
MF_SSL_CERT_VERIFICATION_FAILED_MESSAGE:
Mail was unable to verify the identity of this server, which has a certificate issued to “%1$@”. The error was:

%2$@

You might be connecting to a computer that is pretending to be “%3$@”, and putting your confidential information at risk.
SMIME_UNTRUSTED_SIGNING_CERT_MESSAGE: You have chosen not to trust the S/MIME certificate used by “%@” to sign this message.
SSL_UNKNOWN_ROOT_CERT_FORMAT: The root certificate for this server could not be verified.
IMAP_OPEN_FAILED_MSG_FORMAT: Mail was unable to open this mailbox on the server “%@”.
NO_SMTP_HOST: You have not specified an SMTP server in Mail Preferences. You must specify a server before you can send mail.
READONLY_ACCOUNT_DIR_MESSAGE_FORMAT: The account path %@ is not writable. Please change the Account Directory field in the Account Options tab to a writable directory
SMIME_CONFIRM_SIGNATURE_FORMAT: Mail was unable to verify the authenticity of the S/MIME certificate provided by “%@”. Messages signed by this user may be coming from a different source.
INVALID_HOST_MESSAGE_FORMAT: The “Incoming Mail Server” field cannot be empty.
SMIME_MISSING_ENCRYPTION_CERT_MESSAGE: You can’t send encrypted messages because an encryption certificate for the address “%@” could not be found.
CONNECTION_FAILED: The mail server “%@” is not responding. Verify that you have entered the correct account info in Mail settings.
SMTP_INVALID_SENDER_ADDRESS: The sender address “%@” was rejected by the server.
YAHOO_SPECIAL_ID_ERROR: Log into your Yahoo! Account at www.yahoo.com

MF_FAILED_SEND_MESSAGE_REJECTED: The message was rejected by the server.
SMIME_DAMAGED_SIG: The digital signature for this message is incorrect. The message may have been tampered with or corrupted since being signed by “%@”.
BAD_CHARSET_FORMAT: Some characters in your message could not be converted to the “%@” text encoding. Please choose a different entry from the “Text Encoding” menu.
MF_SMTP_SENDING_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: Sending the message failed because you exceeded your sending limit.
NO_RECIPIENTS: This message couldn’t be delivered because you haven't specified any recipients.
IMAP_COMPACT_FAILED: Mail was unable to remove the deleted messages in the mailbox “%1$@” on server “%2$@”.
SSL_NO_ROOT_CERT_FORMAT: There is no root certificate for this server.
YAHOO_NONEXISTENT_ID_ERROR: Verify your account settings in Mail, Contacts, Calendars.
SMIME_CANT_SIGN_MESSAGE: An error occurred while trying to sign this message with a certificate from “%@”. Verify that your certificate for this address is correct, and that its private key is in your keychain.
INVALID_ACCOUNT_DIR_MESSAGE_FORMAT: The account path %1$@ is already being used by the account “%2$@”
INVALID_USER_MESSAGE: The “User Name” field cannot be empty.
FAILED_LOGIN: The user name or password for “%@” is incorrect.

SSL_CERT_CHAIN_INVALID_FORMAT: The certificate for the server is invalid.
MF_SMTP_RECIPIENT_UNKNOWN: The recipient “%@” was rejected by the server because the user is unknown.
MF_SMTP_RECIPIENT_INVALID_ADDRESS: The recipient “%@” was rejected by the server because it is not a valid email address.
SMIME_MISSING_ENCRYPTION_IDENTITY_FORMAT: You can’t send encrypted messages because an encryption identity for the address “%@” could not be found.  Go to the Advanced settings for this account to choose an encryption identity.
CONNECTION_REFUSED: The server “%1$@” refused to allow a connection on port %2$d.
NO_OFFLINE_MAILBOX_RENAMING: You can’t rename mailboxes while an account is offline.
MF_SMTP_RECIPIENT_RELAYING_NOT_ALLOWED: The recipient “%@” was rejected by the server because it does not allow relaying.
MF_SSL_CONNECTION_FAILURE: Mail was unable to connect to server “%1$@” using SSL on port %2$d. Verify that this server supports SSL and that your account settings are correct.
INVALID_PASSWORD_FORMAT: Enter the password for the %1$@ account “%2$@”
SMIME_CANT_DECRYPT_MESSAGE: This message is encrypted.  Install a profile containing your encryption identity to decrypt this message.
CONNECT_FAILED_NO_REASON_FORMAT: There may be a problem with the mail server or network. Check the settings for account “%@” or try again.
DUP_ACCOUNT_FORMAT: The account “%@” already has this hostname and username.
SMTP_SENDING_CONTENT_LATER: Mail will try to send the message again later.
DONT_KNOW_SERVICE_PORT: Can’t determine port to use for the TCP/IP service “%@”.

HOST_UNREACHABLE: The server “%1$@” cannot be contacted on port %2$d.
